Shurduk, The good half troll of Harad
Fralas, the elven king of Harandor
1.content:
Are you Marduk, The good son of Sauron? You pledged your alliance to the free peoples and know of the way that gollum knew into Mordor. You act as Gandalf's spy in Mordor. You speak spider, which is how you managed to befriend Shelob and convince her to let you use the tunnel without her eating you. You use a bow with poisoned arrows,poisoned arrows, it is said, which come from the venom of Shelob.

Or perhaps you are Shurduk, The good half troll. You do not have the bloodthirsty and harsh characteristics of your fellows and for that you have been thrown out of the land of Harad where you lived. You are not like your fellows, you do not turn to stone in sunlight, but during the day you can choose for your torso to turn to stone. This makes for strong armour. You went north to the land of gondor and came across some rangers of the North. They would have killed you if their captain, Aragorn had not stopped them, saying "This creature bears no weapon, we should ask him his intentions" The rangers heard your story and their captain, Aragorn, son of Arathorn, took pity on you. He sent you to Rivendell where Elrond also pitied you and let you stay there. you have the strength of ten men and carry a two handed axe in one hand, you also carry an 8ft longsword and a shield. You also carry a bow and poisoned arrows. You are a master with poison as you grew up learning about it.

Or maybe you are Fralas, The elven king of Harandor. It is rumoured that you are descended from Turgon himself. He is a stronger fighter even than Aragorn himself. He is more stubborn than Gimli and they often argue. Often, you duel to settle disputes. You think this is what makes you a good king. You are wrong. You are a good king because you always put your people before yourself. You are gifted in magic and carry a staff and a bow that is made of Mithril.

Or perhaps you are Murder, The daughter of Sauron. You escaped from Mordor when you were young with the help of your brother Marduk. He took you to Rivendell. There you learned the arts of the elves and decided to join them against Mordor. You know the pass of Cirith Ungol just like your brother and he taught you to speak spider too. You use no weapon, "Fists are all the weapons I need" you can cast magic. But have no need of a staff. Although Gandalf makes you use one.



Or perhaps you will chose your own character and weapons. You decide, Even the smallest person can change the course of the future. Follow the basic storyline but apart from that make it as unconventional as you like.
1.title: Who are you?

11.content:
You had been called to the council of Elrond as Elrond believed that you had information that could help with the ring. You were going to help them to get into Mordor and to the crack of doom. You were looking forward to seeing your sister Murder again. No doubt she would challenge you to an unarmed combat match. You worried about her. She is a bit of a hot head and if she doesn't keep her mind on task she could end up getting herself killed. You knew that she was just as well trained in each of the weapons as in unarmed combat. You knew that you had no cause to worry and that she had made lots of friends. It was partly because of Murder that you had not been killed yet. Elrond would have killed you on the spot if Murder hadn't stopped him one night when you came to visit her. Now you were spying in Mordor so as to get all the information you could. You recently heard that the nine had left Minas Morgul and you had no doubt why. The ring had been found.

You had to destroy the ring, and you knew you would be the only one who could do it. Suddenly, You saw someone you knew.
11.title: Marduk, The good son of Sauron

111.content: "Marduk" said Murder, hugging you "What news from Mordor?" "Same old, same old" you say, shrugging "Orcs fighting each other for control of their tribes, tribes fighting each other, the captains are as bad as the warriors" "What about Father" asked Murder "Has he caught you yet?" You shook your head. "If he had caught me, I'd be back in the Twilight Realm" The twilight realm was the world of the rings. The twisted spirits of the Ringwraiths were bound in this world and it was in this world that you and Murder had been trapped for years. You had managed to escape and, taking Murder with you, you fled to Rivendell. Only recently had you gone backto Mordor. Elrond believed that Sauron was marshalling an army. "I need to go and see Elrond" you say "I have information he needs to hear" Murder took you to Elrond's chambers. "Marduk" said Elrond "What news?" "Saruman has joined Sauron" you say "He has betrayed us" How does Elrond react?
111.title: Murder, your sister

1111.content: "This is either a treacherous manipulation or your giving me grave news" said Elrond "I had thought the ring would be safe here, but it appears we must destroy it" "As we both know, Elrond, there is only one way to do that" you say "And we may be taking the ring right into Sauron's hands" "What otther choice do we have?" asked Elrond "If it is true what you say, if we keep the ring here, Sauron and Saruman shall attack, we don't have the strength to beat Mordor and Isengard" You understood what Elrond had said. "The ring cannot stay here" you say "We must destroy it" "I have called this council to decide what to do with the ring" said Elrond "You are welcome to attend, but I must warn you, most of the council don't trust you, many of them still don't trust Murder, although they've known her for years"
1111.title: Surprised

11112.content: "So, Murder, how's your weapons training going?" you ask, grinning. Murder scoffed. "You know I have no need for a weapon" she replied. "I think I may just have found the weapon for you" you say, pulling a pair of spiked gauntlets out from under your cloak "In the land of Harad, there are assasins known as the Hasharii, they invented these, I forged this pair in the dwarven mines, they are made of mithril" Murder's tried on the gauntlets. She fouund they were light enough not to slow her punches. "Mithril is as light as a feather and as hard as a dragon scale, I even added some enchantments so that you won't feel the weight of it at all, it'll be exactly the same as you normally fight, but you'll be ten times more deadly" Murder hugged you. As she hugged you, the spikes scraped your back. "Careful" you grunted "those spikes are sharp" Murder withdrew. "There's one other thing, give me one of the gauntlets" Murder handed you one of the gauntlets. You closed your fist and pressed an indent on the palm. A blade shot from the knuckles. "I utilized the twilight realm to store that blade, when activated, it comes out of the twilight realm and attatches itself there, as it spent time in the twilight realm, it never rusts, never ages, it will stay exactly the same" You retract the blade. "Now, would you like to see if you can beat me in a duel, or will we go to the council"
11112.title: Talk to your sister

choices: We have to go to the council meeting now
111121.content: You stand apart from Murder. You have chosen to use two short elven blades for this fight. Murder has chosen her new Fists of Death. Several elves had gathered around to watch you fight. Many of them had fought you before, none of them had been able to beat you. Arwen was there to referee. She pointed her sword into the air, then brought it down. This signalled the start of the duel. You and Murder circled each other, ready to strike at the other's weakness. You feinted a stumble to get Murder to charge. She took the bait and charged you. You sidestepped her and kicked her down. You put the point of the sword between her shoulder blades. You had one this round. "Marduk wins round one" said Arwen. Murder got up and retreated to twenty steps away. "Two more rounds to go" said Murder "I can still win this" You grinned. "Don't bet on it" you say, holding one sword out in front of you with the other above your head. Arwen's sword came up again. It went down and the second round began. This time, you charged. two blades came from Murder's weapons. She thrust one of her fists at you. You parried the blow before striking with your other sword. She brought her blade into contact with your sword, pushing it back. You matched her strength. As you concentrated, you almost missed the attack from Murder's other weapon. You met her blade with your other sword. Sparks were flying from your weapons now, but neither of you were wavering. You had to do something as this was draining your energy. Your thoughts were interrupted as Murder's blades retracted into her Fists of Death, she dropped to her knees, grabbed your wrists and threw you over her head onto your back. You were so shocked it took you a few moments to realise you had lost the round. Murder pulled off one of the gauntlets and helped you up. "Round three?"
111121.title: Duel

1111211.content: Arwen's sword had barely came down when you and Murder were locked together again by your weapons. Soon, the blade in your left hand was locked with both of Murder's blades. She pushed hard against it, then grinned. Pulling one of her hands away, she knocked your blade from the side. The blade flew out of your hand. Murder stepped back and removed her left Fist of Death. You now both had only one weapon. You gripped the multi-purpose elven blade in two hands. You charged again, at the same time that Murder charged. At the last moment, you twisted out of the way, stuck out your leg and tripped Murder up. You went to put your sword between her shoulder blades as before, but she rolled over and hit your sword from the side, with enough force to knock it from your hand. She again got up, retreated, and threw away her other Fist of Death. Now you were both weaponless. The only weapons you had were your fists. You had once chastised Murder for using no weapon. Now she had put you in a position to have to fight without one too. "That round was a draw" said Arwen "Round four to choose the winner"
1111211.title: Round 3

choices: The Fellowship is formed. You are in it.
The Fellowship is formed. You are not in it.
11112112.content: As you were about to start, the twin sons of Elrond, Elladan and Elronhir, ran into the training area. "Murder, Marduk, your presence is needed at the council" You glanced at Murder. "We'd better run" you say, dropping your fists. Murder nodded and you both raced towards the council chamber. When you got there, you both sat down next to each other. "Good of you to join us" said Elrond "Now, you have all been called here to decide the fate of the One Ring" A hobbit came forward and placed the ring on a stone in the center. "The Ring cannot stay here" said Elrond "Gandalf has brought great tidings from Orthanc, Saruman the White has betrayed us" There were murmurs of disbelief, shock, even anger at this statement. You had heard Sauron had a new ally, you just didn't think it was Saruman. "Then there's only one thing we can do then" said Murder "The ring must be destroyed" "That would be suicide" you say "The only way to destroy the ring is to cast it into the fires from whence it came, the fires of Mt Doom" You felt a shudder move around the room at the name. On the slopes of this mountain, Gilgalad, High King of the Elves was slain, as was Elendil, King of Gondor. It was here that Isildur, son of the king, cut the ring from Sauron's hand and in doing so, defeated him. Elrond had been present at this battle, he urged Isildur to destroy the ring then and there, but Isildur was already under the Ring's influence. He carried it with him on his return to Gondor, but was ambushed and the ring fell from his grasp, lost. This was the last you had heard of the ring. You wondered how this hobbit came by it.
11112112.title: Interruption

choices: Aragorn and the hobbits are alone
Arwen has arrived ahead of you
113.content:
"Marduk," said Elrond "I must speak with you."
You motioned him to go ahead.
"The ring is coming to Rivendell in the hands of a hobbit, Aragorn, son of Arathorn is leading the hobbit as well as three other hobbits that travel with him, they were supposed to be here by now, very few people are privy to this information, I am sending you and Lady Arwen to find out what happened to them and bring them to Rivendell safely, I'm still not sure if I can trust you completely, but I trust Murder, and she assures me you can be trusted,"
You nodded "I hope that in the future, you can find it in your heart to give me the trust I have so long tried to earn, Lord Elrond."
"As do I," said Elrond "But for now, you must make haste, Arwen is waiting for you in the stables."
You nodded and ran off to the stables. Arwen sat astride her horse, yours alongside it. You quickly climbed onto the horse and nodded to her. Both horses galloped across the Bruinen and galloped off on the road towards Bree.
"Aragorn is a ranger," said Arwen "He will not stick to the roads, he knows they will most likely be followed on them, we need to search the wilderness between here and Weathertop,"
You nodded, veering your horse off the road and trying to find the trail of the group while following a common search pattern.
You and Murder had used this pattern when hunting when they had escaped from Mordor. Now, combining it with your tracking skills, you had become an extremely good tracker, on par with the rangers of the North. As such, it doesn't take you long to find the hobbits and Aragorn.
113.title: Elrond, your employer

choices: The plan works, the Black Riders divide to follow both you and Arwen's mounts
The plan doesn't work, the Riders follow Arwen
The plan doesn't work, the Riders follow you
1131.content:
You ride up to the group, making no attempt to hide your presence from them.
"Aragorn, we haven't met, but my name is Marduk, I've been tracking you, Lord Elrond worries about your absence,"
"We could not make Rivendell as quickly as we anticipated," said Aragorn "One of our number was stabbed by a Morgul blade, we have tried to move with all haste, but it has been difficult with the Black Riders tracking us."
You heard a hammer of hooves as Arwen rode up, also dismounting.
"We must get this hobbit to Lord Elrond," said Arwen, after looking over the hobbit on the pony "I'll take him."
"It's too dangerous," said Aragorn "Allow me to ride with him."
"I am the faster rider," said Arwen "And this hobbit does not have long."
"If the Black Riders are tracking us," you say "We need a decoy, I give off a similar energy to the ring, if I take a hobbit that isn't Frodo, they won't know who has the ring."
"I'll come with you then, Mister Marduk," another hobbit spoke up. He seemed to have crammed a variety of hobbit sized kitchen implements stuffed into his luggage.
"What's your name," you say
"Samwise Gamgee," said the hobbit
"Come on up, Master Sam," you say "We'll see if we can divide the Black Riders."
1131.title: Aragorn and the hobbits are alone

choices: Bilbo (Sometimes you sit and swap tales and songs with him)
Gimli (You and him never get on)
12.content: You look around. It was daylight. To you, it was very bright as you were used to the night. You were safe in Rivendell and had known for ages about the council of Elrond that was soon to happen. You knew that Elrond was inviting all the most important people in Middle Earth, elves, dwarves, men, it was even rumoured that Gandalf the Grey was coming. That wasn't why you were excited. You were hoping that Elessar, who had saved you from almost certain death during your exile from Harad and sent you to Rivendell where you were fed and kept warm. You were surprised, kindness was not something you had had much experience of in your homeland. Suddenly you saw someone you knew.
12.title: Shurduk, The good half troll of Harad

121.content: "Elessar, how are you!" you shout over to Aragorn. He turned. His eyes lit up. "I was hoping to run into you here, it's been a long time" said Aragorn "I need your help" "What do you need?" you ask. "Gandalf told me to go and collect the ringbearer from Hobbiton" said Aragorn "He has already left for Bree" "I don't think i'd be welcome in Bree, my people murdered a lot of good men from there" you say "What is it you need of me?" "I have been asked to escort the ringbearer, but i could do with a hidden scout, will you be my eyes and ears for the path ahead?" "Yes" you say "When do we leave?"
121.title: Elessar

choices: Find another way to warn Aragorn
1211.content: "I was just leaving now" said Aragorn. "Just let me collect my weapons and i'll join you at the gates of Rivendell" you say, going to your home. You colect your axe, your sword and your bow. You then join Aragorn at the gate. "Shall we go" you say. Aragorn leads the way out of Rivendell and takes the wilderness route to Bree. "I'll wait here" you say "They will not welcome me here" Aragorn went on alone. You found a hiding place and got ready to wait out the night. When night came, you heard a strange screeching noise. Looking onto the road, you saw five men in black cloaks. You were familiar with these men. They were the Nazgul. Their leader the Witch King of Angmar had scared your people into making war with Gondor. You had to warn Aragorn, but to do that, you would have to go into Bree and with your troll like appearance, they would not like it.
1211.title: Aragorn says now

choices: No it doesn't.!  How does the village react?
12111.content:
You had to warn Aragorn, you just had to!

Men might fear you though so you tried to do your best to disguise your appearance. You put on a heavy cloak, hunched your back and tried to hide your facial features. You can only hope the folk of Bree don't peer inside your hood.

Does your disguise work?
12111.title: Go into Bree

choices: Aragorn's group is blocked by a hooded figure
12113.content: The Ringwraiths were nearing the gates of Bree. When they got close, you shouted. "Halt, Witch King of Angmar, I have a hundred archers in the hills, come any closer, and death will rain down upon you" The Black Riders continued, unhindered. You knelt down and pulled on a piece of string. Several hundred arrows flew from bushes, trees and places in front of the Ringwraiths. Their horses reared, surprised. "I warned you" you say "Leave, that first volley was a warning, the next volley will be for the kill" The Witch King came to the fore of his riders. "You shall pay for thissss" said the Witch King, his voice, like the many poisonous snakes of your homeland, was dripping with poison. He turned his horse around and galloped away from Bree. The rest of his riders turned and followed. You sank to the ground, relieved that you had stopped them. If they had continued, you would have had to fight. Before the Ringwraiths had reached Bree, you had set up slings in the bushes, fitting many arrows into the slings. You had then tied a piece of string through them all and left it next to you while you confronted the Ringwraiths. It had been a clever strategy, but if they had continued, you would have had to fight to stop them. You collected your slings and string and headed back to the bush to wait for Aragorn. Little did you know, the Ringwraiths came back and tried to attack the Ring bearer and his companions. Aragorn had found them first, you saw as they left Bree, but that tale is for another time. Now, you followed behind Aragorn's group as it headed towards Rivendell.
12113.title: Confront the Ringwraiths

choices: You find horse tracks that aren't the Black Riders tracks
You reach Aragorn and find that he is talking to an elf woman
121131.content: Aragorn's group had reached Weathertop. On the pretense of going to get firewood, Aragorn came to meet up with you. "What news?" he asked. "Five Black Riders are less than 12 hours ride from here" you say "There are also men following you at a greater distance, I am not sure of their allegiance" "Thank you for the information" said Aragorn "I need you to intercept the men, find out who they work for, I will deal with the Black Riders" "If I go chasing these men, I won't be able to help you fight the Black Riders" you say. "I think I can deal with the Black Riders" said Aragorn "Now go" You ran off into the trees. Despite being slightly larger than the largest man, you left no trail for anyone to follow. You soon located the men, for you could run faster than horses, and ambushed them, using a paralysing dart which paralysed every part of the body except the head. You scored two direct hits, paralysing both the men who were tracking Aragorn. You ran to them. "Why were you following us?" you said. The men's eyes looked up at you in fear as they tried to speak, but your appearance had frightened them. "Who sent you?" you said. "Saruman the White" said one of the men, quickly as if he was trying to free himself from a rope. You said nothing. Saruman the White, leader of the Order of Wizards, was on the side of good. Why would he be chasing Aragorn? "Why does he seek the Ring bearer?" you asked, after all, it would make more sense. You had heard of powerful men seeking the ring for power. "Saruman the White wants the hobbits" said one of the men "He said we were to stop them reaching Rivendell. "Your not going to stop them" you say "Saruman the White will not get the power he seeks" You then took some rope that was lying at their campsite, removed their weapons, placing them on your belt, and then tied them both together. You then picked up the hobbit's trail again and started to follow.
121131.title: You reach Weathertop

choices: Go along with Arwen and Frodo
Suggest that you delay the Black Riders
1211311.content:
A single horses tracks were scattered around the area in a search pattern. However, these tracks were lighter than the iron-shod Black Riders horse tracks. This horse could only be ridden by an elf. You quickly ran forward to tell Aragorn. You then stay with the group as a deterrent to any foes that may be lurking around. The six of them were on their guard now, it was possible that the rider of the horse was a foe, however unlikely. You spotted her first, pointing her out to Aragorn as her horse moved stealthily through the trees. Both you and Aragorn tracked her, until she stopped, got off her horse and searched the ground for more tracks.
"What's this, an elf caught off her guard," you said playfully, as the elf jumped.
"Shurduk?" she asked, looking up. It was then that you recognized the elf. Her name was Arwen Evenstar, only daughter of Elrond Halfelven. While you had spent a lot more time with her older brothers, Elladan and Elrohir among the Rangers of the North, you had met Arwen several times in the past.
"We need your aid," said Aragorn, indicating the injured Frodo on the pony.
"We must get him to my father," said Arwen "I shall take him, I am the faster rider."
"It's too dangerous," said Aragorn "I should go."
"No," said Arwen "Asfaloth answers to me alone, but Shurduk can run alongside me, I would be grateful for his extra protection."
1211311.title: You find horse tracks that aren't the Black...

choices: A small creature that looks a lot like Bilbo (Frodo)
125.title: Someone else

choices: Gandalf, He sometimes helped teach you magic
Aragorn, You had once duelled him for fun and won
Legolas, You once lived in Mirkwood where you and him struck up a friendship
Arwen, Elrond wanted her to marry you instead of Aragorn
Gimli, You had once met him when he was working in a mine in Harandor
13.content:
You sighed. You had been journeying for days and it was comforting to come at last to Rivendell. You had been summoned to the council of Elrond. You knew why the council had been called and, thinking of your people, you decided to help with the destruction of the ring. Leaving your son in charge of Harandor, you had chosen the swiftest horse, and rode to Rivendell. While on your way there, you encountered an old friend of your people, Radagast the Brown. You asked him to watch over your people and if anything happened, he was to send one of his many birds to tell you of it, for Radagast had been more than a friend of your people. He had been your master when you studied magic. Radagast was responsible for seeking out the elves who carry the blood of the Istari, for years ago, elves were given magic, but this magic was locked away when Morgoth, the first dark lord, came to power. After Morgoth had fallen, the magic was released. Radagast could find the elven Istari, selected elves who had the capacity to learn magic. You had been one of them and you had excelled at magic. You needed to go back to watch over your people once your basic training was completed however. But you are still skilled, even for a novice. You reached Rivendell and see an old friend.

Who did you see?
13.title: Fralas, the elven king of Harandor

133.content: Legolas, prince of Mirkwood had been your best friend as a child. You were never aloud to hang out with "Common folk" as your father called them. One year, your father took you up to Mirkwood, where you met Legolas. He was your first real friend. "Hey Legolas" you said, seeing him leaning against a tree. "Hey Fralas" said Legolas, running to greet you. "What are you doing here?" "I have been summoned to the council of Elrond" you said "I suppose it must be important for them to invite me" "They called me too" said Legolas "It's starting soon, we should go to the council chambers.
133.title: Legolas, You once lived in Mirkwood where you a...

1332.content: "So what have you been doing since I last saw you?" said Legolas "Well, we managed to destroy a company of orcs trying to cross my lands" You said "We had a few orc invasions too" said Legolas "We drove them back but they kept coming back with more numbers, I fear that soon they will outnumber us, that is part of the reason I came here, to get aid from Elrond against the orcs, hopefully we can find the orc base and take them out" "I can send some of my best men to help you out" you said "We are all elves and we should band together, maybe before we leave Middle Earth, we can put a large dent in the orc forces" "Yeah!, that's what i'm talking about" said Legolas, holding up his hand for a high five. You slapped his hand. "We'd better go to the council now" you say
1332.title: Continue talking to Legolas

choices: Getting the lava (Not joining the fellowship)
13321.content: Very soon, the reason for the meeting was revealed. The One Ring had been found. Elrond wished to destroy the ring by casting it into the flames of Mt Doom. "I don't think we can do this" said Boromir "One does not simply walk into Mordor" "I have another option" you say "The lava of Mt Doom is the only thing that can destroy the ring, yes?" "That's right" said Elrond. "Then instead of bringing the ring into Mordor, why not bring some of the lava here?" you say "With our skill in magic, I'm sure we could create something that would contain the lava" "We would need some form of diversion" said Elrond. "My spy in Mordor could get you in" said Gandalf "We helped him, he smuggled his sister out of Mordor" "That's right" said a dark haired girl "He could get us in" Looking at the girl, you realised that she seemed to have the appearance of a human but the wisdom of an elf in her eyes. "Then that's settled then" said Gandalf "We will split into two separate groups, one carrying the ring, the other moving to get the lava" Do you go with the group carrying the ring, or the group sneaking into Mordor to get the lava?
13321.title: At the council

133212.content: Your group consisted of the girl with the dark hair, Murder, daughter of Sauron, and a strange looking man, Shurduck. He was bigger than a normal man and you were certain he had some troll blood in him. You knew he had been neglected by the people of Harad in the south and come to Rivendell. Also accompanying you was a female Istari in yellow robes. Your group would meet up with Murder's brother when you got to Mordor.
133212.title: Getting the lava (Not joining the fellowship)

choices: Elrond says that Elladan and Elronhir are joining them on their quest
Elladan and Elronhir are going scouting to inform you of enemies so you can avoi
1332122.content: Elrond had decided to send the Fellowhip out ahead of them. If they set out together, they may be pursued. The next day, two elves arrived at Rivendell. The elves were alike and looked a lot like Elrond. "Elladan, Elronhir" said Elrond. The two elves walked into the council chamber. Elrond shut the door. "Who were they?" you asked. "You are not familiar with the twin sons of Elrond?" asked Murder. You mentally kicked yourself. You had been so caught up in the running of your realm, making sure you hadn't been invaded by orcs, you had failed to keep up relations in your own race. "Tell me about them" you say. Murder begins. "When the twins were born, they were inseperable, they trained together, they fought side by side, they decided to go wandering, they joined the Rangers of the North in the lands surrounding Gondor" "I wonder why they're here" you say. "Looks like we're about to find out" said Shurduck, indicating the doors to the council chambers.
1332122.title: You wait a few days

13321221.content: It was around midday that you saw Elrond approach with his sons. "We have been talking, and we think that Elladan and Elronhir should join your group" said Elrond. You turned to your companions. Shurduck stepped forward. "I have fought alongside these twins, they would be invaluable both in battle and in travelling" "I think they should join us" said Murder "There's only four of us, we need a bigger group, if we're attacked we'll be overwhelmed" You turned back to Elrond. "We'll take them" you say "Elrond, when do we set out?"
13321221.title: Elrond says that Elladan and Elronhir are joini...

choices: The fellowship set out, the spell works
The fellowship set out, the spell doesn't work
133212211.content:
"Right away," said Elrond "I have seen some of Saruman's spies on the outskirts of this realm. They do not know the ring has already set out, so perhaps they will follow you, or if not, I want you to track their movements and see where they go,"
You bowed to Elrond, collected your prepared pack, as well as your weapons, and got ready to leave Rivendell with your companions. Ishmael, the Istari Female, watched you, her pack already on her shoulders.
"We must make the enemy believe one of us has the ring," you say "More than that, we must make sure the enemy believes that the real Fellowship is the decoy, for we must attract attention away from them."

When her brothers got older, they would always play fight with toy weapons, and then her brothers joined the guard. Although she had wanted to join too, she was not yet old enough. She continued play fighting with her brothers when they were off duty. Her brothers were still in the Royal Guard, and still protected the King. In exchange, you told her a part of your own story, how you were raised in Rivendell, trained in magic by Gandalf, and eventually, went on the quest for the ring, which pretty much brought her up to the present.
"You haven't told me everything," stated the extremely perceptive Hannah.
"No, I haven't," you said "There are some parts of my past that I feel ashamed to talk about, it would only dampen both our spirits before the battle."
"O.K," Hannah accepted "Promise you will tell me after the battle?"
"I promise," you said. As you looked back out onto the battlefield, a figure on horseback in the distance brought a smile to your face.
"Take a message to King Théoden," you said "Tell him simply 'the strider has returned.'"

choices: Skip to the start of the battle
145311221122212211111112111122111122.content:
You immediately ran out of the gates of the Hornburg, where you had been perched, and towards the tired horse and injured rider. You took Aragorn off the horse and onto you own shoulders, carrying him so the horse could be relieved of its burden. He stirred as he was transferred, and as you ran back towards the gates, he woke up. His horse followed you at its own pace, able to keep up now it was not carrying him.

As you entered the gates, refugees were all around shouting "Hes alive." You set Aragorn on his feet, still allowing him to lean on you as you heard Gimli's voice.
"Where is he, I'm going to kill him." Gimli emerged from the crowd.
"You," he said "Are the luckiest, canniest, the most desperate man I ever knew, bless you Aragorn."
Aragorn patted Gimli on the shoulder "Where is the king?" Gimli gestures in the direction of the hall. As you and Aragorn make for the hall, your path is again blocked by Legolas.
"Your late," said Legolas, in elvish "You look terrible." Legolas gives Aragorn the pendant recovered at the battle. Aragorn smiles, and thanks Legolas in elvish.

When you entered the hall, still supporting Aragorn, he told Théoden of what he saw.
"A great host, you say?" asked Théoden
"All Isengard is emptied," said Aragorn
"How many?" asked Théoden
"Ten thousand strong at least," Aragorn replied
"Ten thousand!?" exclaimed Théoden, disbelievingly
"It is an army bred for a single purpose," you said "To destroy the world of men."
"That's not all," said Aragorn "It is rumoured that Saruman himself rides with his armies."
"Saruman is coming here?" asked Théoden "Then we are lost."
"We can still fight," you say "Saruman the White is powerful, but so am I, I can use my own magic to counter his advantage, it's your decision, King Théoden, but I'm just telling you so you know your options."
"Whatever you decide," said Aragorn "Some dark sorcery spurs these creatures on, they will be here by nightfall."
"Let them come," said Théoden.

He then went out of the hall, and addressed his captains "I want every man and strong lad able to bear arms, to be ready for battle by nightfall."
Théoden then turns to you, Aragorn, Legolas and Gimli "We'll cover the causeway, and the gate from above, no army has ever breached the Deeping Wall, or set foot inside the Hornburg."
"This is no rabble of mindless orcs," said Gimli "These are Uruk Hai. Their armour is thick, and their shields broad."
"I have fought many wars, Master Dwarf," said Théoden "I know how to defend my own keep."
"I can work magic from my original watching post on the Hornburg," you said "If I can take out Saruman, I will."
"Saruman's forces will break on this fortress like water on rock," said Théoden "They will pillage and burn, we've seen it before. Crops can be resown, homes rebuilt. We will outlast them."
"They do not come to destroy Rohan's crops and villages," said Aragorn, his voice rising a little "They come to destroy its people, down to the last child!"
"What would you have me do?" asked Théoden "Look at my end. Their courage hangs by a thread. If this is to be their end, then I would have them make such an end as to be worthy of remembrance."
"Send out riders, my lord," said Aragorn "Rohan must call for aid."
"And who would come?" asked Théoden "Elves? Dwarves? We are not so lucky in our friends as you. The old alliances are dead."
"Gondor will answer," said Aragorn
"Gondor," said Théoden, his voice again angry "Where was Gondor when the Westfold fell? Where was Gondor when our enemies closed in around us? Where was Gon..." Théoden stopped.
"No, my lord Aragorn, we are on our own."

Théoden walked away, calling orders "Get the women and children into the caves."
As men rush to secure the gate, you head back to your post on the Hornburg, dropping by the weapons store on your way to collect your staff. You found Hannah on the Hornburg gate.
145311221122212211111112111122111122.title: Going out to meet Aragorn

1453112211222122111111121111221111221.content:
You and Hannah continued to watch the ground in front of Helms deep, waiting for the enemy. It wasn't long before you both spotted warriors in the distance.
"I'll go tell King Théoden," said Hannah, but you stopped her.
"Those are no orcs," you said, a small smile on your face "It looks like the old alliances are not as dead as Théoden believes."
As the large host of elves neared, a horn blasted from them.
You ran along the wall to the main gates. You watched as the army of elves got nearer. Now there was no mistaking them, you recognised Haldir of Lothlorien, and Elladan and Elrohir, the twin sons of Elrond.

You heard panting as Hannah arrived next to you.
"Sorry," you said "I forgot, I'm faster than most of my kind."
"That's O.K," said Hannah, still panting "Just give me a lift next time, will you?"
"Agreed," you replied, then shouted "Open the gate!"
You saw Aragorn, Legolas and Gimli emerge from the armoury. You went to join them, along with Hannah.
"Who comes?" asked Aragorn
"A host of elves from Lothlorien and Rivendell," you replied "I recognised Haldir and the sons of Elrond among them."
"We've sent for the king," said Gamling, still a little shocked at the number that had come.

The elves had marched through the gates and were standing before them as Théoden arrived.
"How is this possible?" asked Elrond
A woman in full battle armour came through the elven warriors. You immediately recognised Galadriel in elegant white armour.
"Long ago," said Galadriel "An alliance existed between our peoples. We fought and died together. We come to honour that alliance, here at Helm's Deep, and in the remainder of the War of the Ring."

Aragorn, Legolas, Gimli and you bow to Galadriel. Then Aragorn welcomed the group in Elvish.
Then, Haldir said "We are proud to fight alongside men once more."
It took a few hours, but the elves and men were positioned on the battlements, ready for battle. You conversed with Galadriel.
"Saruman rides with the Uruk hai," you said "I put on a good show of being up for fighting against him, but I'm an Istari in training, and he's the head of the order, if I could have stood up to his magic, it wouldn't have been for long."
"Do not despair, Murder," said Galadriel "I foresaw Saruman's presence here, so came with my armies to fight alongside you."
"I've got the Hornburg covered," you say "I can defend it with my magic and it's a good position to cast from, you'll fight with your warriors on the main gate?"
"I will," said Galadriel "Elladan and Elrohir shall aid you in defending the Hornburg."
"Are you an angel?" asked Hannah of Galadriel. You'd sent her to find out if the elves needed any provisions. Galadriel laughed. "Who's this? I thought all the Rohirrin women and children were sent to the caves."
"She wanted to fight," you said "I said she could carry messages for me and fight alongside me in the battle, she is an extremely gifted fighter, her name is Hannah."
"Well, Hannah," said Galadriel "I am not an angel, but I hope my presence at the battle will bring the same thing an angel brings. Hope."

You returned to your vantage point on the Hornburg, finding Elladan and Elrohir waiting for you.

14531122112221221111111211112211112211.content: You watched as ten thousand uruk hai marched into the ravine At the back of the army, you saw Saruman talking to two of his captains. An uruk captain at the front climbed onto a big rock and yelled in the harsh tongue of the orcs. All the uruks began banging their spears on their shields. You saw Eowyn on the Deeping Wall, rallying the troops to yell in defiance. They did, yelling abuse at the orcs and cheering. The uruk leader put his hand up, then blew his horn. And all hell broke loose. The Uruks charged. Many carried ladders which were raised to the Deeping Wall. You aimed your staff, then concentrated. A wave of energy came from your staff, smashing each ladder as some uruks got halfway up. However, your spell didn't extend very far, so a few ladders stayed up and several uruks managed to get over the walls. The ones that had been on the ladders fell to the ground, many of them dying or injured to the point they could not continue. More ladders were brought up and they again brought them up to the walls. Before you could fire again, a fireball came at your position from below. You immediately cast a powerful shield around the area you were at. The fireball was absorbed by the shield, the energy added to your staff. You fired the absorbed fireball at a group of uruk hai, destroying both them and their ladder before they could reach the walls. Elladan and Elrohir climbed onto the parapet where you were firing from, also covered by the shield, they fired arrows at uruks on the walls.
14531122112221221111111211112211112211.title: The battle begins

choices: Find out what he is casting at the wall
145311221122212211111112111122111122112.content:
"How would you two like to take the fight to the enemy?" you asked Elladan and Elrohir.
They grinned, answering in unison "I thought you'd never ask."
"I need to take Saruman," you said "Without one of the Istari backing them up, we should be able to take out the rest of the army without very much trouble."
"We'll get you to him," said Elladan, leaping down onto the causeway, and drawing his twin elven blades. Just as an Uruk shield wall hiding a battering ram started up the causeway.
"Murder, can you do something about this?" asked Elrohir, casually, dropping down beside his twin, also drawing two elven blades.
You aimed with your staff, and jumped over the twins heads, doing two somersaults in the air, and slamming your staff down. A shockwave emanated out from where you landed, smashing most of the shields in the shield wall but not killing any of them.
"You know, you could have killed them," said Elladan.
"I don't need to," you said, gesturing to the wall, where the elf archers on the walls were already taking aim. So many uruk hai were killed in the following volley, the ones remaining alive were neither able to maintain the shield wall, nor continue to hold the battering ram.
"Hey boys, do you mind?" you asked. Elladan and Elrohir yelled as they ran into battle, slashing at the uruk hai still alive on the causeway. Soon, the causeway was clear of living uruk hai. You touched your staff to the ram, muttering an incantation as you walked past. The ram glowed with electric blue light. Satisfied, you aimed your staff at a group of uruk hai coming towards you. A bolt of blue lightning shot from the end of the staff at the uruk hai in the centre of the party. The lightning forked to the other twelve uruk hai in the party, causing them all to collapse to the ground, dead.
You ran through the centre of them, firing more spells from your staff at other groups of uruk hai as you looked around for Saruman. Then you saw him, protected by his captains, he was pointing his staff at a point in the wall.

You and Gandalf go to where Elladan and Elrohir are guarding Saruman
1453112211222122111111121111221111221122.content:
You muttered your own spell, aiming at Saruman's staff. It was a special spell used to detect magic. Your eyes widened. Saruman was using an area cloaking spell. There was some form of weapon hidden in the area Saruman was concentrating on.
You aimed your staff at Saruman and fired a second spell at him. This one was far more powerful than the cloaking spell, and it knocked him through several of his own uruk hai, killing them as he came to rest on his back. As several uruk hai tried to attack you, now more of them had taken notice of you, Elladan and Elrohir battled them, leaving a ring around you and Saruman clear.

Saruman got to his feet, using his staff to aid him.
"This is all pointless, you know," said Saruman "While you fight a war here, defending this thatched barn, the Dark Lord musters his armies to take all Middle Earth, we will rule together."
"Are you serious?" you asked "You seriously think that my father will share power with you? Then your crazier than I thought."
You and Saruman began to circle each other, keeping the same distance.
"It is the leaders of men who do not know that their war is already lost," said Saruman "They are outnumbered and outflanked, I shall crush Rohan, and his armies shall crush Gondor, the world of men will fall."
"I thought I might be able to talk you round to our way of thinking," you said "But it seems obvious that that's not going to happen."
And then you did something that Saruman did not expect. You laid your staff on the ground.
"I have no need of a weapon," you said "I'll beat you without the aid of my staff."
"Then you shall die," said Saruman. His staff glowed with blue light, and a bolt of blue lightning shot towards you. It stopped in its path about a foot away from you, as a bright, white orb of light appeared around you.
"There is only one lord of the ring," you said, as both your hands glowed blue. You put them together, pointing them towards Saruman "And let me tell you, Saruman, my father does not share power."
You spread your arms wide. The blue energy travelled up your arms and to your body. It travelled down your body and along your legs, which rose slightly, so you were hovering a few feet above the ground. You put both your hands together, and a much larger bolt of blue lightning came from them, hitting Saruman in the chest, causing him to be thrown out of the circle. You pointed your hand at your staff, and it flew into your hands. Pointing it at Saruman, you concentrated. His decent was slowed just enough, that he was knocked unconscious. You then fell back to the ground, slamming your staff into the ground as you did. A shockwave of magical energy emanated from you, knocking ever uruk hai within a three mile radius to the ground.

Elladan and Elrohir, the only two left standing, ran around the knocked over uruk hai, slicing through as many of their necks as possible.
You ran to where Saruman lay, taking his staff, and putting it with your own on your back. Then you looked around, to see Elladan and Elrohir running full pelt away from the wall. You saw an armoured uruk hai running towards it with a flaming brand. You pointed both staves at him, and lifted him off the ground, throwing him into his fellows, the brand being extinguished. You then looked to Elladan and Elrohir, beckoning to them. They ran over, dispatching more uruk hai as they did.
"Saruman is still alive," you said "I've taken his staff, but he's still dangerous, guard him, and don't listen to a word he says."
You ran towards the wall, pulling out both staves as you did, firing spell after spell at the uruk hai around you. When you reached the wall, you found several containers filled with an extremely flammable substance. You pointed your own staff at the containers, causing them to levitate, then threw them to different points on the battlefield. As they were coming down, you fired a fireball at each one. They all exploded, killing many uruk hai. However, at least half of the uruks numbers were still alive, and attacking. The night was almost over, you saw the first rays of the rising sun came into the valley, and they illuminated a rider, dressed in white, holding a white staff and riding a white steed. While you were happy to see Gandalf again, you once again questioned his sanity. Was he really going to attack 5000 uruk hai on his own? Then, more riders were revealed, as they rode forward to the top of the hill. Even from this distance, your elvish eyesight picked out Eomer and his eored. They charged down the hill, as Gandalf raised his staff, white light shone from it as the horses drove into the uruk hai.
At the same time, the gates to the hornburg opened and Théoden led a host of many horsemen in a charge towards the uruk hai.
"Charge!" shouted a female voice, and you looked around to see Galadriel and Eowyn leading a huge amount of elves and men, male and female alike charged out of the main gate. The uruk hai were pushed back on all sides, being pushed towards the river. Many who tried to swim across. Galadriel cast a spell, causing the river to kill the uruk hai swimming across, and then rise up, crashing down on the uruk hai from behind.

An Uruk Hai captain stepped forward, and spoke in the common tongue.
"We beg mercy from the combined armies of elves and men," he said "You have beaten us, we surrender."
You stepped forward, the two staves on your back, you spoke "Lay down your arms," you said, in the tongue of the orc, so that the ones who did not speak the common tongue could understand.
"Why do you allow these creatures to live?" asked Théoden "They have slaughtered Rohan's towns and villages, why should we be merciful." As he spoke, the uruks had already lain down their arms. You used your magic to levitate the weapons and throw them across the river.
"If you would like to kill defenceless prisoners," you said "Go ahead, King Théoden."
Théoden lowered his sword, placing it back in it's scabbard. "Where do we put them all?" asked Théoden "Rohan is poor, we do not have large prisons and we do not have the money to feed them."
"We fight with you," said the uruk hai captain "The Uruks and the men of Rohan will fight together."
"We can take them," said Galadriel "The orcs were once elves, twisted and changed into what they are today, perhaps we can find a way to help them."
"But your people sail to the undying lands," said Aragorn "How will you help the uruks if you sail there?"
"Elrond believes that the time of the elves is over," said Galadriel "But I do not agree, we are abandoning men to their fate, the elves are at least partially responsible for Sauron's rise to power, and for Sauron himself, I will not abandon Middle Earth to a fate created by my people, we fight with you, and we will do all within our power to cure the uruks."
"Thank you, my lady," said the uruk hai captain "And when the time comes, we fight with the people of Rohan."
1453112211222122111111121111221111221122.title: Find out what he is casting at the wall

1453112211222122111111121111221111221122.content:
You saw Elladan and Elrohir approaching with Saruman.
"Hello, my old friend," said Gandalf "Of all the people that I thought would fall to darkness, you were low on my list."

"Gondor will fall, Gandalf," said Saruman "Your plan to put Isildur's heir on the throne will not come to fruition, Rohan will fall after Gondor has been brought under the dark lord's rule."

"Rohan's army has increased in number," you said "The armies of Isengard have joined us, and the elves of Lothlorien have agreed to fight with Rohan."

"The dark lord has allies of his own," said Saruman "The Corsairs of Umbar, the Haradrim of the South and the harsh men of the east, he is already gathering all armies to him, an army big enough to conquer all Middle Earth, your all going to die."

"We're not getting anything out of him," you say "He's given us all he knows. Now, hand over the Palantir."
Saruman's eyes widened in shock.

"Oh, don't look so surprised, I know Isengard has one, I know my father took the Palantir from Minas Ithil when he invaded it, turning it into Minas Morgul, it didn't take me long to figure out that you had one too, that's how you and Sauron made your allegiance," you say "I can't allow a tainted artefact to stay in the hands of a known enemy. Hand it over."

Saruman reluctantly pulled the Palantir out of his cloak, handing it to you. You looked at Gandalf. He put his hand inside his cloak and used the cloak to take the Palantir, stowing it in the cloak.

"Magical items like this can lure you into evil," you said "We'll imprison him in the tower of Orthanc, when we get there."

"Yes," said Gandalf "Good choice, we'll maintain a guard on him until we can go to Orthanc."

You went to a council on Gandalf's behalf, representing him there. Galadriel represented the elves of Lothlorien, along with Elladan and Elrohir. Aragorn represented Gondor, while Théoden and Eomer represented Rohan. An uruk captain called Lurkan represented the uruk hai.

"My father's wrath will be terrible," you said "His retribution will be swift, the Battle for Helm's Deep is over, the Battle for Middle Earth is about to begin."

"He will attack Gondor," said Aragorn "Gondor will call for our aid by lighting the beacons, when they are lit, Rohan must be ready for war."

"Rohan is in no position to go to Gondor's aid," said Théoden "We must rebuild our villages, replant our crops, this war has left Rohan weak."

"The Uruks will be ready," said Lurkan "We are always ready for war."

"The elves of Lothlorien will be ready when called," said Galadriel "We will also assist with Rohan's rebuilding until the beacons are lit."

"Let us not speak of such things now," said Théoden "What is still to be done?"

"While the Uruks attacked Rohan," you say "The Ents of Fangorn attacked Isengard, their leader Treebeard would be a valuable ally if we can convince him to join our cause, and we must imprison Saruman in Orthanc until he has learned the error of his ways."

"Agreed," said Théoden "One thing I learned from this battle, Rohan's policy toward women enlisting in the army is wrong, effective immediately, women are to be treated, in military matters, in the same way as men."

"You can implement that when we return to Rohan," you said "Right now, we've got to go to Isengard, just the army generals need go, the rest of the army can head back to Rohan, we'll meet you back there."

1453112211222122111111121111221111221122.content:
You rode to Isengard with all speed, keeping a guard on Saruman the whole time. It was slower progress than you would have liked, but eventually you found your way back to Isengard. As you came in view of Isengard, you heard a cry of joy, as a small figure raised a flagon of ale.
"Welcome, my lords and ladies, to Isengard,"
You smiled, as you recognised the forms of Merry and Pippin.

Gimli was not so happy to see them. "You young rascals," he said, stuttering slightly "A merry hunt you've led us on and we find you feasting and smoking."
"Peace, Gimli," you said, smiling slightly
"We are sitting, on a field of victory, and enjoying a few well-deserved comforts," said Pippin "The salted pork is particularly good."
You shook your head, the young hobbit knew just how to get Gimli's attention.
"Salted pork?" asked Gimli, eager.
You heard Gandalf say under his breath "Hobbits,"
"We're under orders, from Treebeard, who has taken over management, of Isengard," said Pippin
"That inferior tree has taken over my home?" asked Saruman, disgusted "I've changed my mind, I'm not cooperating anymore."

You reacted quicker than Saruman did, and a strange circle glowed on the ground around him, just as he conjured a fireball. It immediately fizzled out.
"I don't think you get to do that," you said "Your still alive, because you may still have information we might need, don't do anything to make me change my mind, you won't like me when I'm angry."
Red light has appeared in your eyes, causing Saruman to shrink back. You notice that several of the horses around Saruman have recoiled as well.
"What?" you asked, as the light vanished, returning your eyes to their normal green.
"Nothing," said one horseman "Just thought we saw something, ma'am."
You shrugged, and moved forwards, the circle you cast moving with you and forcing Saruman to walk. Because you were a little distracted by what happened, you didn't notice the gleam in Saruman's eyes.

Deciding that you didn't really need to go and meet Treebeard, having met him already, you passed the circle spell over to Gandalf's staff, and waited with Merry and Pippin, chatting with them. However, they seemed to be eyeing you warily, too.
"What's wrong?" you asked "Why do you recoil?"
"Something happened after you cast that circle spell," said Pippin "It's gone now, but your eyes, they turned red, and it seemed like they were made of fire."
You immediately thought of the eye of your father. How could he be affecting you, though? He enslaved the Ringwraiths through their rings, the orcs were his to command, and the trolls were as brutal as he, so why were you being affected by him?
You quickly took out some old parchment, and quill, drawing something on it.
"Like this?" you asked, after you had drawn a picture of your father's eye.
"Yeah," said Pippin "Exactly like that, only like fire, why, is it something that's happened before?"
"No," you said "Nothing like that's ever happened before, the picture I drew was of the eye of my father."
"Sauron?" asked Merry "Are you saying your eyes changed to look like Sauron's eye?
"I don't know," you said "I didn't see it, I'll have to ask Gandalf if anything like this has happened before."
"Anyway," said Pippin, trying to lighten the situation slightly "Want some food? We raided Saruman's stores after the battle, here, have some."

You spent the rest of the day talking about other things, until Gandalf and the others returned. It was time to return to Edoras, Saruman was trapped and powerless, you had his staff to add to your own power, and your magic circle prevented him from casting any magic.
1453112211222122111111121111221111221122.title: To Isengard

1453112211222122111111121111221111221122.content:
You rode next to Gandalf on the return journey.
"Something happened at Orthanc," you said "Merry and Pippin saw my father's eyes within mine."
"I had heard of magic like this," Gandalf sighed "Your exposure to the twilit realm of the ringwraiths gave you more than just the capacity to learn magic, I believe that when Sauron recovered the Palantir from Minas Ithil, he linked the twilit realm to the Palantiri. Because Sauron holds the Palantir of Minas Ithil, when he gazes upon it, he is linked to every other Palantir, even to you."
"So in theory, if someone were to touch me while Sauron was watching, Sauron would be able to see us?" you asked, trying to understand.
"In theory," said Gandalf "Like I said, this sort of thing has never happened before."
"I don't know what to do," you said "I don't want my father to know I can see into his plans, but there's not much I can do about it. The hobbits are already spooked just by seeing my father's eye in my own eyes. I don't wish any more harm on them."
"Nor do I," said Gandalf "And I hope they do not come to any more harm, but these are dark times, I fear they will not be kept out of this war much longer."

It was night, and you slept. You had a nightmare. A white tree was burning in a courtyard of stone, a white city was also burning, and then you saw Sauron coming up towards you, and Pippin appeared in front of you. He looked terrified. Sauron asked him his name, but he didn't answer. I tried to look away, but I could not, but no matter how much psychological torture Pippin was put through, he told Sauron nothing of Frodo or the ring. You tried to pull yourself away from Sauron, away from Pippin, and everything faded to black as you woke. Pippin was on the floor, trembling. You reached him first, muttering a spell to bring him out of his fear. He immediately scrambled away from you. Gandalf got Pippin to tell him what happened. After Gandalf was finished, you went over to Pippin, and tried to talk to him. You managed to convince him you were still the same person. Sauron had a lot to answer for. You wished you could deliver the killing blow yourself. But you would do your part. What you had seen suggested that Sauron was going to attack Gondor. Warning them about the attack and preparing the defence of the city was the best you could do. There was another thing yours and Pippin's encounter with Sauron had done. Sauron now thought Pippin had the ring. This could work to the Free Peoples' advantage. This, and more, was discussed in a meeting. a few days after the Palantir incident. It was decided that Gandalf, Pippin and you would go to Gondor.
1453112211222122111111121111221111221122.title: Speaking to Gandalf on the return to Edoras

1453112211222122111111121111221111221122.content:
It took you a while to reach Minas Tirith, almost a week of hard riding. You didn't tire easily, when you had awoken from your seemingly eternal hell in the Ringwraiths twilit realm, you had felt like awaking from a nightmare. As such, you were very reluctant to sleep every night, for fear of returning to that place. Pippin was under no such illusions, and slept during the nights. It gave you and Gandalf time to talk.
"I've messed up now," you said "I should be able to block that sort of thing out, especially since I knew about it, now Pippin's been brought into a war."
"He was already in the war," said Gandalf "This was never my intent, I do not wish harm to the hobbits, they give me hope, though, they will all play their part in the days to come."

1453112211222122111111121111221111221122.content:
You followed Gandalf and Pippin towards the throne. An elderly man sat there, he was bent over on the throne, and you noticed that he was holding something.
"Hail Denethor, son of Ecthellion, Lord and Steward of Gondor," said Gandalf. As you got closer, you noticed that the thing Denethor was holding was a split arm guard, that you recognised as belonging to Boromir "I come with tidings in this dark hour, and with counsel."
"Perhaps you come to explain this," said Denethor "Perhaps you come to tell me why my son is dead?"
You looked to Denethor. His city was about to be invaded, and he was here wallowing in his grief over his sons death. You understood his grief, but a good leader had to be able to put aside that grief in times of greatest need. You had never liked Boromir personally, but you had respected him for his martial prowess and he did seem to have a soft spot for the youngest hobbits. You were about to speak all of this to Denethor, when Pippin stepped forward.
"Boromir died to save us," said Pippin "My kinsmen and me, he died defending us from many foes." Pippin walked up to the throne, and knelt down.
"I offer you my service, such as it is, in payment of this debt," said Pippin.
"This is my first command to you," said Denethor "How did you escape, and my son did not? So mighty a man as he was."
"The mightiest man may be slain by one arrow," said Pippin "But Boromir was pierced by many."
You were surprised, Pippin spoke as an elf lord, or human noble would. You had no idea he could be so, for lack of a better word, noble.
"This is not the time to grieve Boromir, Lord Denethor," you said "But Gondor needs a strong leader for the war that is to come, you could be that leader."
"The enemy is on your doorstep," said Gandalf "As steward, you are charged with the defence of this city, where are Gondor's armies?"
"You still have friends, lord," you said "The Rohirrin are ready to ride, and my kin ride with them, your allies will not desert Gondor in its time of need."
"Send word to Théoden of Rohan," said Gandalf "Light the beacons."
"You think that you are wise, Mithrandir," said Denethor "Yet for all your subtelties, you have not wisdom, do you think the eyes of the white tower are blind?"
"Perhaps not," you say "But if they do not call for aid, then Gondor will be besieged, how long can you stand against the armies of Mordor, there are over 10000 orcs within Mordor, and cruel men of the South and East enter Mordor every day, if you do not call for aid, Gondor will soon wave the banner of the Eye."
"You shall not speak to me of how to run my city, elf," said Denethor "And you, wizard, I see your game, with your left hand you would use me as a shield against Mordor, and with your right you would seek to supplant me. I know who rides with Théoden of Rohan, and know that this Aragorn, son of Arathorn, shall never be crowned king, I will not bow to this Ranger from the North, last of a long house long bereft of lordship."
"Authority is not given to you to deny the return of the king, Steward," said Gandalf
Denethor stood from his seat. "Rule of Gondor is mine, ignore this."
Gandalf, seemingly appalled at Denethor's refusal to call for aid, turned to leave.
You waited before the throne "You would do well to think on this, Son of Ecthellion, for the elves do not give their aid willingly, and will not give it again if you do not accept it this time." You turned, and followed Gandalf and Pippin out of the hall.

1521121.content:
Sinnoh awoke with a start and his body was filled with life and energy. "Where am I this time?" He thought as felt his vision return to him. Looking around, he notices that he's in some kind of forest teeming with life and beauty. After getting an eye full of the scenery, he searches himself. He was clothed in simple rags and had nothing protecting him. On his belt, he felt an odd weight bringing it down. He instinctively reaches down and feels his hand grasp a hilt of some kind. With great ease, he unsheaths a mighty, if somewhat broad blade, from his belt. Examining it, he looked at it in discuss. "A pitiful blade." He thought putting back into its sheath.

On his back, he finds a large spear and a set of bow and arrows. Holding the spear, he tests its wait and gets a natural feeling with it. It was more acceptable than the sword and more useful. Slinging it back onto his back, he takes out the bow. To his disappointment, the bow was a simple one, made of a sturdy wood. The arrows weren't very good quality either and he almost considered getting rid of the bow. In the end though kept the weapon, he would never willingly throw away a useable weapon.

Finished with his self inspection, Sinnoh began trekking out into the forest. His journey did not last long, for he was soon interrupted. Turning around a tree, he found himself face to tip with an arrow. In front of him was a large elf and he was surrounded on all sides by several other elves. Sinnoh, not wanting a fight after getting into this world so quickly, surrenders. "You are a smart boy." One elf said as he bound Sinnoh's hands behind his back. "I am no mere boy." Sinnoh corrected. "I am much wiser than a boy. A child would have tried to fight you off."

Sinnoh was abruptly ordered to march as he followed the leading elf through the forest. "Would you mind telling me where we are?" Sinnoh asks out loud. "You are in the realm of Rivendell my friend." Said the leader. "Ah. That's where we are. Well that's good news I guess." Sinnoh says. "Where are you taking me?" One of the elves stared at him, "You ask too many questions." he complained. "We are taking you to Rivendell. "What have I done to deserve this treatment?" Sinnoh asked. "I have done nothing wrong, but you insist on taking me prisoner? That doesn't sound fair to me."

After sternly being to told to "hold your tongue" Sinnoh remains silent for the rest of the march. After a long time, he could see out in the distance a great city of beauty. It appeared to be built into some kind of mountain and had a beautiful waterfall flowing throughout it. It was a truly magnificent sight, and Sinnoh was glad that he was being taken to such a beautiful place. He was soon left inside of an empty room, and sat there alone for quite some time while quietly whistling to himself. Soon, Sinnoh grew bored and started looking around at the various artifacts in the room. Examining each carefully, he admires their beauty before heading up stairs.

When he reaches upstairs, he's presented with the most stunning sight he had seen yet in this world. On a wall. There was a large mosaic-like painting of a man leaning on a stone, holding up a broken sword as a shadowy figure glared down at him while it swung its mighty mace at him. Directly across from it, was a statue of a woman with her hand outstretched. On those hands, was a cloth on which a broken sword lay. Several shards lay scattered across the cloth while part of the sword remained on the hilt. If this sword was to be re forged, it would be just like when it was first made. Eventually, Sinnoh's curiosity left him and he went back downstairs, sat back down, and made himself comfortable.

Soon, a tall elf with long black hair and an imposing figure enters the room accompanied by two other elves. Standing up, Sinnoh bows respectfully before the elf. The elf replies with a bow of his own and speaks to Sinnoh. "Welcome to Rivendell. I am Elrond, Lord of Rivendell. What is your name and business in these lands?" He asks. "My Lord Elrond," Sinnoh began. "I am Sinnoh, a simple traveler who has stumbled upon your lands. I may seem young to you, but I have lived through many tings that have matured me beyond count of age. My business is my own, but I do not yet know it. For my goal in this world is unclear to me at the time."

"What do you speak of?" Elrond asked. "You are only a child, barely yet considerable a man. But yet you claim that you have lived through many things that have matured you beyond reckoning. Explain what you mean to me!" Sinnoh chuckled to himself. "To do that, I would need to show you something that I must get; but I can't do that with my hands bound. Would you release them for me?" "I shall start from the beginning; but I warn you, this tale is long and you will most likely not believe me." Sinnoh said.

And so Sinnoh told Elrond everything. He told him about his life and the founding of the magic stone. He explained that he had lived through many perilous quests and journeys in many different worlds and how they all matured him. He also explained that the stone prevented him from aging and that in reality he should be about twenty years old. Finally Sinnoh finished his story and Lord Elrond spoke his mind, "I can see no lie in your eyes or mind. You have my trust. What a strange tale." He said. Suddenly, one of the elves spoke, "Lord Elrond the council meeting shall start soon. You must go now." The elf said. "Very well." Lord Elrond said standing up. "Come with me Sinnoh. 152121.content:
As you came upon the land of Rivendell, you began to feel nervous and you knew that putting on a false sense of confidence would only betray you in the future. Still, you were raised by your adopted father to finish all that you started so you thanked the giant eagle as he gently dropped you from a safe distance and flew off.

"And so, my journey begins." you said to yourself.

Then, the sounds of battle reached your ears, with the cry of a young woman. You immediately ran to the woman's aid, ready to draw your sword, to find a young female elf engaged in mock hand to hand combat. She was pitted against a male elf, wielding a long blade dagger. The cry you had heard was the young elf girl laughing at the male elf's efforts to score a hit. "Maybe you need a bigger target, Slade." teased the elf girl. "Perhaps a sleeping mountain troll."

"I will make you eat those words with a taste of my dagger, Murder." replied Slade, noticing you watching their practice combat session. "I have only been toying with you thus far."

Murder let out another short laugh before kicking dagger out of Slade's hand and expertly threw him to the floor. "Do not boast until you have something to boast about, Slade." she said, seriously. "You have much to learn if you are to truly follow in Elrond's footsteps and become the next leader of Rivendell."

Slade got up, struggling not to blush in front of you, a human visitor, and left, claiming his dagger as he went. Before he left, Murder added, "You are making fine progress, Slade, do not lose heart."

Slade nodded then gave you a look before leaving. "Um... sorry if I distracted him." you said, feeling a little guilty.

"Young Slade must be able to block out such distractions if he is to be an effective fighter, and leader." replied Murder, lightly, taking up a towel. "Do not fear, though, he has a good heart, he will not hold a grudge against you."

You watched Murder dabbed the sweat from her brow and found your heart racing, looking at her beauty. "I have never seen an elf up close like this before." you thought. "Her beauty is beyond compare." then, realizing what you were thinking, you asked. "Why did you face him without a weapon?"

Murder laughed, it was the most pure and melodious laugh you had ever heard. "I don't need a weapon." she said, smiling. "Were you not paying attention to the lesson I served Slade?" she then placed the towel aside and faced you directly. "So, what brings a young human such as you to Rivendell?"

"I am Cire, son of Bard, King of Lonely Valley." you answered. "I have come to join the fellowship in their quest to destroy the evil ring before it falls into the hands of destruction."

Murder looked at you, a small grin of amusement on her face. "You look rather young to be joining such a quest." she said. "Are you certain you can handle the perils that will surely await us?"

You grinned. "Perhaps I can answer that question with a friendly unarmed match up." you suggested. "Of course, you will need to rest up, first. It would not be fair of me to challenge you now."

Murder smiled at your comment. Although you lack of knowledge regarding elves was obvious, she found it noble of you not to want to take what you clearly saw as an advantage over her. "You have never faced and elven warrior before, have you, prince Cire?" she asked.

"No, I have not." you replied, honestly. "However, I have proven myself against the strongest humans in my kingdom." you then blushed. "Also, about price Cire, please drop the prince part. Here, I wish to be treated as the others, no better, no worse."

Now, Murder was slightly impressed. "He is not like other humans of royalty." she thought. "This one actually has a touch of modesty to spite his arrogance." then she said, "A true warrior must be able to fight at his or her best, regardless of how tired they feel, until the battle has ended."

"You then accept my challenge now?" you asked, slightly surprised. "I will not hold back, I fight to win."

"I would be insulted if you did hold back, young Cire." said Murder, seriously. "You may place your weapons an armor on the table to your right. Before you enter further, please remove your shoes as well."

You nodded and proceeded to disarm yourself. Unknown to you, Murder was watching your every move, looking for a limp, a wince when you move a certain muscle, anything she could use to her advantage. she was not doing this to gain any advantage, it was a skill she had learned and it became automatic. As you finished, a few minutes later, Murder was pleased to see you were quite strong for her age, which meant she did not have to go soft on you to avoid breaking your bones.

"The boy does not realize how much stronger elves are to humans." she thought. "But, then again, I learned the hard way myself never to underestimate a human." she inwardly giggled. "They are always full of surprises."

Soon, you were ready and you entered the dojo type building with your shoes off to face her. "What are the conditions of this match up?" you asked. "What determines a victory?"

Murder pointed to a large painted circle on the floor. "The victor will be the one to throw their opponent to the floor, outside this ring, three times without being thrown by the other." she replied. "The rules are simple, no weapons other than your hands and feet, no touching of 'forbidden' parts of the body, and finally..." she smiled. "No crying when 'you' lose to me."

You smiled at that. "I expect you to follow that same third rule, should I be victorious." you countered.

"Of course, young Cire." replied Murder, amused. "Though I doubt that will happen."

With that said, the contest began...

"Wait a minute!" you said, struggling to gain control of your horse, Arwen. "They got a sniff of something they don't like!"
