1521212212122122211211112111221212211132.content:
Sure enough, your ears were now pointed, like an elf. You chose not to dwell on it, as a rider approached from the gathering Rohirrin.
"What business, does a group of elves and men have in the Riddermark?" asked the rider
"We come to reinforce the garrison of Helm's Deep," said Tauriel "We also have information that may be of worth to your king."
"My name is Cire, daughter of Bard," you said "This is Henner, daughter of Lilian, Tauriel of the Woodland Realm, and Murder. We knew your people made for Helm's Deep, so we made our way there to reinforce you. When we found it not yet occupied, we assumed Saruman's treachery had befallen you on the road, and made our way here. Lucky that we did. Have you encountered these creatures before?"
"They have been plaguing our outlying villages for many days," said the rider "Usually in the company of Uruk Hai bearing the White Hand of Saruman."
"We must speak to the king," said Murder "We would speak with him on the matter of defending Helm's Deep."

The rider, who said his name was Gamling, brought the group before King Theoden.
"We are grateful for your aid," said Theoden "Rohan is truly lucky to have allies such as you in this dark time."
"A dark time for all of us," said Murder "And in these dark times, we must keep our friends all the closer. We have another reason for coming to Helm's Deep, but we will divulge it when we arrive there."
"I have heard of your quest," said Theoden "To destroy the ring of Smaug before it can bring him back, we welcome your aid."
1521212212122122211211112111221212211132.title: You now have elven ears.

1521212212122122211211112111221212211132.content:
"Tauriel," said a familiar voice from the crowd, speaking in Sindarin, one of the Elven languages "Why come you here?"
You turned to see Legolas approaching, with Gimli following close behind. Legolas pulled Tauriel aside, and began speaking with her in quiet tones.
"Hello Murder," said Gimli "How goes your quest to destroy the ring of Smaug?"
"It goes well," you said "The quest has changed, we have heard that Sauron seeks the components to create a machine that will remake this world anew. One of the components are in Helm's Deep."
"Hello Cire," said Gimli, after staring at you for a moment, unable to recognise you "Rather impressive display of magic you did earlier."
"I thank you for your words," you replied "Was it just you two who came to Rohan's aid, where is the Ringbearer?"
"He goes down a dark path," said Gimli "The Fellowship was broken when we made camp at Amon Hen, Boromir tried to take the ring from Frodo, and Frodo ran, Sam with him, he slipped away during an ambush by Uruk Hai, Boromir killed many uruks to protect Merry and Pippin from the uruks, but he was almost felled by arrows from the uruk captain. Aragorn slew the captain before he could deliver the killing blow, and managed to stabilise him. The last we heard of him, he returned to Gondor, he sees the error in his ways, and the ways of his father, and he intends to put things right."
"Then there is hope for redemption for Boromir," you said "What of Merry and Pippin?"
"They were taken," said Gimli "We chased them for weeks, but they were eventually killed by the Rohirrin, who then questioned us on our business. Gandalf left us for a time, and returned garbed in white, with a white staff, he told us Merry and Pippin were safe, and that our new path led to Rohan."
"Where is Aragorn?" you asked
Gimli turned, shouting. "Aragorn!" as he heard other members of the Rohirrin calling Aragorn's name. Legolas broke off from his conversation with Tauriel, and checked around for tracks from the battle. He walked to the edge of a cliff, and looked down.

Suddenly, they heard, a throaty chuckle from a dying orc that lay near the edge.
Gimli went over to him, and picked him up "Tell me what happened to Aragorn and I will ease your passing.
"He's....dead," said the orc "Took a little tumble off the cliff."
Legolas came over and put his sword to the orc's throat "You lie."
The orc chuckled again, and then fell limp in Gimli's hand. The orc's hand opened, and a familiar necklace dangled from his fingers.
Legolas took it up, examining it closely.
"Get the wounded on horses," said a voice. You looked up to see a bearded man with a crowned helmet "These creatures will return, leave the dead."
Legolas stared the man down.
"He's right," you said "We cannot stay here. We can mourn Aragorn when we are safe behind the walls."

1521212212122122211211112111221212211132.content:
The return to Helm's Deep was a sombre one. The Rohirrin mourned the dead, the Riders of Rohan had very little in the way of martial power to begin with, and now, they had been reduced further. The battle was also against the Riders' best tactics, mounted combat. Their manoeuverability, which had seen them through so many battles, would not fair them well in this battle. If Saruman's army was anywhere even half as large as Sauron's, then the Rohirrin would also be outnumbered. But Helm's Deep had stood as a beacon of hope to Rohan for many a day, and it was to Helm's Deep that Theoden now led them.
They rode into the city to cries of relief and hope from the women and children that accompanied them. Theoden began issuing orders to man the walls, and ready every man and strong lad to be ready for battle by nightfall. It was nearing night, when something unexpected happened. You were on watch, when you saw Aragorn's horse, with a tired, haggard, and wounded Aragorn riding atop it.
"Open the gates!" you shouted, and your cry was echoed by others. You ran down to the courtyard, where a small crowd had gathered.
"It's Lord Aragorn," said one
"Where is he, out of my way, I'm going to kill him," Gimli's voice was audible over the murmurs as he pushed his way through. Aragorn slowly lowered himself off his horse, to face Gimli.
"The time for killing is not now," said Aragorn "I must speak to the king."
Gimli clapped Aragorn on the back, nodded, and led him through the crowd.

In the keep, at the back end of Helm's Deep, a war council was called, you, Murder, Tauriel and Legolas were all there, as were the members of the Fellowship that had come to Helm's Deep.
"I saw Saruman's armies," said Aragorn "They are many, orcs that march in the light of day, they travel fast, they outnumber you many times over."
"How many?" asked Theoden
"Ten thousand strong at least," said Aragorn
Theoden looked directly at him "Ten thousand?!"
"It is an army bred for a single purpose," said Aragorn "To destroy the world of men, they will be here by nightfall."
"Let them come," said Theoden. He walked out of the hall. When you were alone, you said "Is he serious?"

You, along with Tauriel, Murder, Legolas,Gimli and Aragorn, followed Theoden out of the hall.
"I want every man and strong lad able to bear arms to be ready for battle by nightfall," said Theoden, to a man in the garb of a captain.
He led you and your companions to the causeway.
"We will cover the caueway and the gate from above," said Theoden "No army has ever breached the Deeping Wall, or set foot inside the Hornburg."
"This is no rabble of mindless orcs," said Gimli "These are Uruk Hai, their armour is thick, their shield's broad."
"I have fought many wars, master dwarf," said Theoden "I know how to defend my own keep."
"And how many of these creatures have you fought personally?" you asked, a little annoyed at Theoden's dismissal of Gimli's combat expertise "If you do not take advantage of the experience of the fighters here, then you are a greater fool than I had once thought."
"Do you know whom you address?" Theoden asked "It is not I who is the fool here, girl, if you had talked that way to me in Edoras, I would have had you flogged and left in prison for a night."
"But you wouldn't," you said "For I am Cire, daughter of King Bard, and with his recent death, now the king of Dale and the surrounding villages."
Theoden stared you down, then seemed to decide that what he was saying was more important than punishing you, and walked past you, out along the Deeping Wall "They will break upon this fortress like water on rock, Saruman's hordes will pillage and burn, we've seen it before. Crops can be resown, homes rebuilt. Within these walls, we will outlast them."
"They do not come to destroy Rohan's crops and villages," said Aragorn "They come to destroy it's people, down to the last child."
Theoden turned, and grabbed Aragorn's arm. "What would you have me do? Look at my men, their courage hangs by a thread. If this is to be their end, then I would make such an end, to be worthy of rememberance."
"Send out riders," said Aragorn "You still have friends, without their aid, Helm's Deep will fall."
"And who would come?" asked Theoden "Elves, Dwarves, we are not so lucky in our friends as you."
"The men of Dale would answer," you said "I can vouch for the fact that my people would come to your aid, perhaps with the dwarves of Erebor at their back, but them I cannot vouch for."
"Gondor will answer," said Aragorn
"Gondor!?" said Theoden, his voice turning to anger "Where was Gondor when the Westfold fell? Where was Gondor when our enemies closed in around us? Where was Gon-?" Theoden broke off.
"The men of Dale are too far away to arrive soon enough to make a difference," said Theoden "I appreciate your offer of aid, Lord Cire, but Rohan will face this threat alone."

1521212212122122211211112111221212211132.content:
In the leadup to the battle, Murder taught you a few basic spells which would allow you to control the water of the River Isen, which flowed into Helm's Deep. Powerful spirits lived in that water, as they did in every river, and most magic is just negotiation with those spirits. That is how Arwen had controlled the water in their fight with the Wargs and their riders. Murder taught that some spirits were twisted, corrupted by the influence of other things, such as the Old Forest on the border of the Shire, where the spirits of the trees such as Old Man Willow were less than benevolent, kept in check only by the Shepherd, also known as Tom Bombadil. You reached your mind out to the river. At first, you felt a presence retreat from your mind, you felt an emotion: Fear, surprise, but also a feeling of pain, as if the presence was wounded. You decided to attempt to broadcast something, a memory of Lake Town during times of peace, a child playing with a kite, a thriving marketplace, with many people, but focused mostly on the clear waters of the lake, and how you would often spend time staring out over the lakes in order to calm your mind. The spirit allowed your mind to connect with it, and immediately, your vision of the Deeping Wall was replaced with a cavern with a large underground lake. You stood up from where you had been meditating, realising that you are once again, male, and panicking, thinking Smaug could return, until you heard a soothing voice, which sounded like a whisper, but you heard as clear as day. You knew instinctively that this was the voice of the river:

"Calm yourself, King Cire, this conversation happens inside your mind," A small geizer of water erupted out of the centre of the lake. You noticed that no ripples were created beyond the geizer, and no waves lapped the shore of the small area of land you were standing on. The geizer seemed to slowly shape itself, becoming vaguely humanoid, as the water slowly died down, a beautiful woman wearing a majestic blue dress with bare feet, stood on the surface of the water as if she were standing on land. She continued to speak within your mind.
"I must confess I am surprised that you have chosen to speak with me, you are only the 4th gifted one to ever speak to me, the first was one of the Children of Illuvitar when they brought me into existence, the second was Radagast the Brown, on his last visit to Isengard, the third was Murder, from the Black Lands, and you were the fourth, what do you wish, human? I felt your compassion and love, hence why I let you in, but what the White Wizard has done to me has left me with little compassion for your kind,"
You wondered what the spirit meant by the fact that Murder had come from the Black Lands. You had often heard Mordor referred to as such, but surely Murder could not have come from there.
"I mean you no harm, if that's what you're asking," you said "What should I call you, what is your name?"
"No-one has ever deigned to ask my name," said the spirit "The Men of Gondor named me Isen, and I guess that will do for now, I have no name."
"You clearly have no love for Saruman and his armies," you said "Why is that?"
"Saruman's war machinery dumps foul contaminents into me," said Isen "Contaminents that cause me much pain, constant pain. I wish an end to that pain, and that will only come when Saruman's forces are defeated. Your plight seems a bleak one, may I aid you in defeating the force arrayed against you?"
"What aid can you give?" you asked, surprised that it had been as easy to procure the spirit's aid.
"My eyes span the entire river," Isen replied "I can warn you of the enemies position, and perhaps hinder their procurement of fish if they so desire it, perhaps drowning a few in my waters. I can also aid in the battle itself, attacking at the right time could sow discord within the ranks of the orcs. For the first time, I feel I can help to save myself, rather than relying on others to do it for me."
"Very well," you replied "Keep me updated, and I'll give you the signal to attack."

154111212.content:
The fellowship is ultimately forced to go to the Mines of Moria.

"Mines, it is a great hall, you will all see!"

Gandalf looks grim and curses Saruman's power that barred the way with storm and snow.

"There is a power in the deep there that will test us. Be wary and be on your guard."

Erestor nods sagely, "Yes Elrond was wise to caution us. Alatar your lore is great, have you some knowledge of Moria?"

You shake your head, "If I had any I would share it with thee. With such powerful companions we can face much danger. If all the nine barred our path we would surely triumph."

Aragorn suddenly looks up, "Creatures in the night!"

Suddenly you all were surrounded by white wolves. Something about them seemed... more dangerous than normal.

Gandalf called out, "Protect Frodo at all costs!"

Gimli and Boromir leap to Frodo's defense hacking down a wolf between axe and blade.

You concentrate and than slam your staff into the ground sending a shock wave out in front of you bowling over a pair of wolves. As they fell to the earth Glorfindel stuck. He did move as swift as lighting, he WAS lightning. Even with your eyes you could barely follow his swift strokes. In less than a second the two wolves you fell were bleeding out.

You turn to see the rest of the fighting. It has gone extremely well. Legolas has feathered several wolves while Gandalf and Aragorn did for another pair together. Erestor fought with two daggers and easily avoided the maw of one wolf, the wise elf let fly a dagger that struck too and smote the wolf to the earth.

Gimli let out a fierce cry of victory, "If that be all the power the Dark Lord can summon than this will be simple!"

You eye Gimli, "Our company is might but do not underestimate the power of Sauron."

Gimli muttered under his breath and the fellowship continued onward.
154111212.title: The Fellowship follows the path of the original...

choices: Let it go and get some rest.
1541112121.content:
You and Gandalf answer the riddle of the gates between you.

As you enter Moria Gimli falls to his knees in shock. There are the remains of dwarves everywhere. Your heart feels pity for poor Gimli. He had been so certain that a warm welcome waited him here.

Erestor spoke, "Let us not tarry here, evil has despoiled this place."

Wise words you thought. You and the rest of the Fellowship make your way to Balin's tomb. There Gimli promises vengeance against the foul creatures who had done this. You had been walking through the mines of Moria for greater than a day and your group decided this would be a good place to rest for the night.

As you rested there Gandalf read a journal. About drums... and the enemy coming. About flame and darkness.

Glorfindel's eyes flash toward Gandalf. "Read that part again."

Gandalf does so and they share a knowing look. You are wise but you had little dealings with the West.

"What is it?"

Gandalf sighs and says, "It is only speculation... but the dwarves may have dug too deep and awoken something that should of stayed buried."

Frodo chimed in, "Like what?"

Gandalf looks troubled, "I do not want to create fear when none may justified."

This comment irks you. Knowledge is power and Gandalf was hoarding it. Should you press the issue and demand an explanation?
1541112121.title: To Moria!

choices: Demand that they confront the Balrog
Attempt to leave Moria, try to avoid the Balrog.
15411121211.content:
"Gandalf we are the wise, knowledge is power. Tell me what you think may be here with us in the mines of Moria?"

Gandalf took you aside away from the rest of the Fellowship.

"Alatar if I am wrong I shall be joyful. I fear I am not. There is a nameless terror that drove out dwarves and elves before Balin attempted to retake Moria. I believe we are dealing with a Balrog."

Fear spiked in your gut. A Balrog was a foe from the time before men walked the earth. A Balrog was immortal, powerful wreathed in flame and shadow. But you stood defiantly.

"Gandalf your concern is justified but we can defeat even this foe. Do you not remember the tales? Glorfindel defeated one, it can be done again."

Glorfindel overheard the conversation with his keen elven ears. "Alatar, I did slay the creature but at the cost of mine own life. A company of elves also perished against the foulness. I have no wish to fight such a beast again. Best we avoid it at all costs."

This did not sit well with you. You had powerful companions and this was a prime opportunity to destroy a great evil. Still the wisdom of Gandalf and Glorfindel was great. Maybe you should listen to them...
15411121211.title: Demand an explanation.

choices: Go through Moria- Kill the Balrog
Go through Moria- Avoid the Balrog
154111212111.content:
"And what of Sauron?" you asked, reverting to your best argument "Glorfindel and many of the elf heroes of old talk of Sauron's master, Morgoth, being extremely powerful with an army of Balrog's at his command, imagine the damage Sauron could do with just one."
"You may have something there," said Gandalf "What do you think of this, Glorfindel?"
"In the time of Morgoth, the first Dark Lord, an army or Balrogs destroyed all members of my family, I was the only survivor," Glorfindel explained "Our intelligence from Mordor told us that the Balrogs were brought into being from a place called the Dark Realm, a place of shadow which the entrance to is in the heart of Mordor, Mount Doom, if Sauron gains this Balrogs allegiance, he may be able to find the Dark Realm, and he will turn all his attention to Mount Doom, if he succeeds, he will have an army of Balrogs at his command, if he fails, he will continue trying to open the way to the Dark Realm, and therefore, our task to get the ring to Mount Doom will be made a lot more difficult."
"I concur with Glorfindel," said Legolas "I do not wish to face more of those creatures than is necessary."
"Aye," said Gimli "And I wish to get into Moria and warn Balin before he is ambushed by the Balrog."
154111212111.title: Demand that they confront the Balrog

choices: Find a good spot and teach them fear.
1541112121111.content:
You are pleased that Gandalf heeded your council, you will seek out and find the mighty Balrog and lay it low.

You begin searching for signs of the creature when you realize that you are not alone in these mines. Goblins crawl along the walls scouting your presence. You have little fear of goblins but even so mighty company such as yourselves can be overwhelmed by numbers. It seems as if you have two options. You could find a defensible position where there is only one entry point - from there you can slaughter the goblins with ease and not be surrounded. Eventually after enough casualties the wretched creatures will flee.

Alternatively you can try to use your arts to distract the goblins and bypass them completely and continue your search for the creature of flame and darkness. However if but one keen eyed goblin spots your company out of position you could quickly become surrounded on all sides.
1541112121111.title: Go through Moria- Kill the Balrog

1541112122.content: A bolt of lightning hit the top of the mountain. Rocks fell into the path ahead of you. Looking up, you saw a large rock coming down on top of you! A second lightning bolt came from below. This one was blue and the rock was obliterated. Looking down, your heart was filled with joy as you saw a familiar figure. "Pallando" you shouted. The figure vanished and appeared next to you. "It is good to see you, Alatar" said Pallando. "I'm sorry, but who are you?" asked Frodo. "Have you not heard of 'The Blue Wizards?'" said Gandalf "Alatar and Pallando have been stirring up trouble for Sauron's allies in the East, trying to incite a rebellion" "I should warn you" said Pallando "Saruman has the very air around this mountain enchanted, you will not make it to the other side" "We must go through the mines of Moria" said Gimli. "I can get you all to the other side" said Pallando "I will need you and Gandalf to help me to do this"

You were scared and quickly used a natural hobbit skill, compounded with the knowledge of the rangers of the north and you hid yourself among the bushes. You watched as a rider, dressed all in black came next to your bush and sniffed. Then he quickly rode off again, obviously, what he was looking for was not here.
